snippet: An Algerian couple detained on suspicion of plotting a terrorist attack in Germany had applied for asylum as Syrian refugees, the police said.
abstract: German authorities say Algerian couple planning terrorist attack in Berlin entered country in 2015 under guise of migrants fleeing violence in Middle East; announcement stokes fears that Islamic State is using migrant crisis as means of infiltrating Europe.
lead_paragraph: An Algerian couple detained on suspicion of plotting a terrorist attack in Germany had applied for asylum as Syrian refugees, the police said.

headline.main: Terrorism Suspects Are Posing as Refugees, Germany Says
headline.print_headline: Germany Says It Fears Terrorism Suspects Are Posing as Refugees

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
